title: Technical Analysis and Stock Market Profits by Richard Schabacke
description:
Originally devised as a practical course for investors, this title presents technical analysis as a totally organized subject and comprehensively lays out the various important patterns, formations, trends, support and resistance areas, and associated supporting technical detail.

Key Features
Author(s)	Richard Schabacker
Publisher	Harriman House Publishing
Date of Publication	23/05/2005
Language(s)	English
Format	Paperback
ISBN-10	1897597568
ISBN-13	9781897597569
Genre	Finance & Accounting

Imprint	Harriman House Publishing

Editorial Details
Format Details	Trade paperback (US)

Description
Table Of Contents	Editor's Introduction Preface to First Edition Study I: Technical Approach to Stock Trading Study II: Important Reversal Formations Study III: Important Reversal Formations (continued) Study IV: Important Reversal Formations (continued) Study V: Minor Reversal Formations Study VI: Major Continuation Patterns Study VII: Trend Line Action Study VIII: Support and Resistance Levels Study X: Measuring Rules and Formations Study XI: Use of Long-Term Charts, Averages and Groups Study XII: Trading Tactics
Author Biography	Richard Schabacker achieved his financial fame in the 1920s and 1930s. First as Financial Editor of Forbes and later as Editor of The Annalist, a weekend section of the New York Times. During this time he also authored three books. To many in the markets, who know of him, he is known as the father of technical analysis
